unnormalised: EdTech startup 'ShikshaNow' secures â‚¹5 Cr in seed funding. The platform, aimed at improving access to quality education in Tier 2 & 3 cities, plans to use the funds to expand its online course offerings and enhance its AI-powered learning platform.
normalised: E-D-Tech startup 'ShikshaNow' secures rupee five crore in seed funding. The platform, aimed at improving access to quality education in Tier two and three cities, plans to use the funds to expand its online course offerings and enhance its A-I-powered learning platform.

unnormalised: ShikshaNow currently offers courses in subjects like Maths, Science, and English for students in classes 6-12, aligned with the CBSE and ICSE boards. They claim over 1 lakh students are already using the platform across India. "We aim to bridge the educational gap and provide affordable, high-quality learning resources to every student, regardless of their location," said CEO, Mr. Rakesh Kumar, an IIT Delhi alumnus.
normalised: ShikshaNow currently offers courses in subjects like Maths, Science, and English for students in classes six to twelve, aligned with the C-B-S-E and I-C-S-E boards. They claim over one lakh students are already using the platform across India. "We aim to bridge the educational gap and provide affordable, high-quality learning resources to every student, regardless of their location," said C-E-O, Mister Rakesh Kumar, an I-I-T Delhi alumnus.

unnormalised: The funding round was led by 'EduVentures India' and saw participation from angel investors. The company is also planning to introduce vocational training programs in areas like coding and digital marketing, targeting young adults and professionals seeking upskilling opportunities. A new 'Skill India' initiative is also in the pipeline for Q4 2024.
normalised: The funding round was led by 'EduVentures India' and saw participation from angel investors. The company is also planning to introduce vocational training programs in areas like coding and digital marketing, targeting young adults and professionals seeking upskilling opportunities. A new 'Skill India' initiative is also in the pipeline for Q four two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: The EdTech sector in India has seen significant growth in recent years, with projections estimating a market size of $4 billion by 2025. Key players include BYJU's, Unacademy, and Vedantu, but ShikshaNow aims to differentiate itself by focusing on vernacular content and personalized learning paths. A free trial is available for the 1st week.
normalised: The E-D-Tech sector in India has seen significant growth in recent years, with projections estimating a market size of dollar four billion by two thousand and twenty five. Key players include B-Y-J-U's, Unacademy, and Vedantu, but ShikshaNow aims to differentiate itself by focusing on vernacular content and personalized learning paths. A free trial is available for the first week.
